sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the College and Career Success for All Students Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the College and Career Success for All Students Act.

sections.heading: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to ensure that each Illinois student has a sufficient education for success after high school and that all students have equal access to a substantive and rigorous curriculum that is designed to challenge their minds, enhance their knowledge and skills, and prepar
sections.text: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to ensure that each Illinois student has a sufficient education for success after high school and that all students have equal access to a substantive and rigorous curriculum that is designed to challenge their minds, enhance their knowledge and skills, and prepare them for success in college and work.

sections.heading: AP exam fee reduction program.  Subject to appropriation, the State Board of Education shall create, under the College and Career Success for All Students program set forth in this Act, a program in public schools where any student who qualifies for free or reduced-price lunches will have fees charg
sections.text: AP exam fee reduction program. Subject to appropriation, the State Board of Education shall create, under the College and Career Success for All Students program set forth in this Act, a program in public schools where any student who qualifies for free or reduced-price lunches will have fees charged by the College Board for Advanced Placement exams reduced, via State subsidy, to the greatest extent possible based on the appropriation.
